## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0606/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 155, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 543]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 543, 880, 573]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 574, 860, 604]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 218, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 680, 682]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 80. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 79, 615, 97]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 139, 576, 159]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 171, 255, 191]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[131, 201, 400, 220]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 220, 596, 256]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 278, 243, 297]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 298, 767, 339]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[131, 351, 514, 392]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 400, 435]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 440, 549, 470]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 351, 513]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = a r^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 515, 445, 580]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 617, 611, 637]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 650, 171, 668]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 678, 598, 730]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \sec^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 772, 256, 791]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 798, 608, 835]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 833, 610, 855]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[455, 861, 571, 890]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A straight line passes through the points (4, 23) and \((- 8, 29)\). Find the point of intersection, \(P\), of this line with the line \(y = 2x + 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 710, 146, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 710, 457, 728]]<|/det|>
Find the distance of \(P\) from the origin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 708, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the non-zero value of \(k\) for which the line \(y = - 2x - 6k - 1\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = x(x + 2k)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 586, 91]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
A cylinder has base radius \((2 + \sqrt{3}) \mathrm{m}\) and volume \(\pi (16 + 9\sqrt{3})\mathrm{m}^3\) . Find the exact value of its height, giving your answer in its simplest form. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 843, 96]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve \(y = x^{3} - 7x^{2} + 12x - 5\) at the point (1, 1).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 465, 146, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 463, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the two points where the normal cuts the curve again. Give your answers in the form \(x = a \pm \sqrt{b}\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 69, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A particle is travelling in a straight line. Its displacement, \(s\) metres, from the origin at time \(t\) seconds is given by \(s = 1.5\mathrm{e}^{2t} + 2\mathrm{e}^{- 2t} - t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 115, 143, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 114, 798, 135]]<|/det|>
Find expressions for the velocity, \(v \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) , and acceleration, \(a \mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\) , of the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 288, 146, 307]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 288, 567, 307]]<|/det|>
Find the time, \(T\) seconds, when the particle is at rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 289, 920, 307]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 398, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x \sin 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 101, 144, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 100, 230, 121]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 918, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 257, 146, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 255, 583, 276]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at \(x = \frac{\pi}{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 258, 918, 276]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 144, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 710, 108]]<|/det|>
Use your answer to part (a) to find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{6}} 2x \cos 2x \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has twelve terms. The sum of the first three terms is \(- 36\) and the sum of the last three terms is 72. Find the first term and the common difference. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of a geometric progression are 1, 1.2 and 1.44. Find the smallest value of \(n\) such that the sum of the first \(n\) terms is greater than 500.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 106, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 655, 92]]<|/det|>
By writing \(\cot x\) and \(\tan x\) in terms of \(\cos x\) and \(\sin x\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 98, 636, 127]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\sin x}{1 - \cot x} +\frac{\cos x}{1 - \tan x} = \sin x + \cos x. \quad [5]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 685, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(9\cot x + 3\cosec x = \tan x,\quad \text{for} 0^\circ < x < 360^\circ .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
